messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: new member on board
messages.msgSnippet: Oyakata holds session: ... Hi Hide, Welcome! I hope you try to participate more often. Don t worry about your English. This should be a great place to
messages.messageBody:
Oyakata holds session:
On Thu, 23 Sep 2004 15:34:18 +0900, <040701@...>さん wrote:
>I'm japanease.My name is Hide.Sorry for my poor english.

Hi Hide,
Welcome! I hope you try to participate more often. Don't worry about
your English. This should be a great place to practice.

割と真面目に日本史を愛し勉強する連中が集まってると思います。多分英語で
も日本語でもいけるはずでしょう。気軽に参加してください！

--
Jay Kelly
oyakata@...

messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Re: new member on board
messages.msgSnippet: Warren, No problem. Although skill in nihongo doesn t necessarily translate to skill in Nihon katchu terms[ :) ] there are also some good links from Tony s
messages.messageBody:
Warren,

No problem. Although skill in nihongo doesn't necessarily translate to
skill in Nihon katchu terms[ :) ] there are also some good links from Tony's
site as well. Of course a google search with the keyword katchu
(�����������j�@should turn up a couple as well. Still as far as DIY there's
nothing better English OR Japanese that I know of.

M.J.Peters

messages.subject: new member on board
messages.msgSnippet: G day all, My name is Warren, I m living in Hobart, Tasmania, Australia and I ve just joined this group. I ve been searching the net for some good sites about
messages.messageBody:
G'day all,

My name is Warren, I'm living in Hobart, Tasmania, Australia and I've
just joined this group. I've been searching the net for some good
sites about authentic, historically documented armour and clothes
patterns (and manufacturing steps for the armour - do it yourself
type stuff). Can anyone point me in the right direction(s)?

Thanks for your time
